canPDOMonitor.pdo¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

PDOConverter

Pulls can frames from can.Device, converts them into data

Format

Contains all PDO format info for the incoming messages

FrameFormat

Specifies the format of a PDO frame

Functions¶

num_2_f7Q8(num)

returns a 2 byte array (LSB) of the given number in 7Q8 format

f7Q8_2_num(byte_arr)

Converts the given LSB 2 byte array to a number using 7Q8 format

num_2_single(num)

Converts the given number to 4 byte array (LSB) in single format

single_2_num(byte_arr)

Converts the LSB 4 byte array to a single float number
class canPDOMonitor.pdo.PDOConverter(device, format)¶

Pulls can frames from can.Device, converts them into data

Requires an active can.Device and Format instance to take raw frames and convert them into data

start(self)¶

Starts the CAN hardware device and a thread to read the frames

stop(self)¶

Stops the underlying can Device and the read thread

Current implmentation will read at most 1 or 2 more can frames from queue before stopping

_read_loop(self)¶

Infinite loop called in thread to pull frames from device and process

_process_frame(self, frame)¶

Takes a frame and uses format to convert to signals

frame : can.Frame

_check_frame_order(self, frame)¶

Takes frame, checks id against format.order using prev frame index

frameFrame

DESCRIPTION.

_extract_datapoints(self, frame, frame_format)¶

Extracts the data from the frame according to format, adds to list

exception canPDOMonitor.pdo.FrameOrderError(msg)¶

Bases: Exception

Common base class for all non-exit exceptions.

exception canPDOMonitor.pdo.ThreadCloseError(msg)¶

Bases: Exception

Common base class for all non-exit exceptions.

class canPDOMonitor.pdo.Format(rate=1000)¶

Contains all PDO format info for the incoming messages

Init an instance and use add function to add a FrameFormat with id the order in which the frames are added determines expected order of frames on the bus

add(self, frame_format)¶
class canPDOMonitor.pdo.FrameFormat(id, active=True, use7Q8=True, gain=[1, 1, 1, 1], offset=[0, 0, 0, 0], name=None)¶

Specifies the format of a PDO frame

Used in conjunction with Format which holds all details of incoming PDO frames and the order which they are expected

canPDOMonitor.pdo.num_2_f7Q8(num)¶

returns a 2 byte array (LSB) of the given number in 7Q8 format

If the value of num is less than -128 or greater than 127.99, the value will be saturated

canPDOMonitor.pdo.f7Q8_2_num(byte_arr)¶

Converts the given LSB 2 byte array to a number using 7Q8 format

canPDOMonitor.pdo.num_2_single(num)¶

Converts the given number to 4 byte array (LSB) in single format

canPDOMonitor.pdo.single_2_num(byte_arr)¶

Converts the LSB 4 byte array to a single float number
